ai_news_elizaos_discord_md_2026-01-04.content:
# elizaOS Discord - 2026-01-04

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Project Development Status
- **DegenAI Development**: Odlitime is continuing development work on DegenAI
- **Eliza Knowledge Data Pipelines**: Jin is working on these pipelines and will soon begin documentation and presentation phases
- **Polymarket Phase 2**: Updates have been made to the git repository, with potential upcoming changes to the ElizaOS polymarket plugin

### Technical Discussions
- **Solana Trading Requirements**: Detailed discussion about technical requirements for profitable trading on Solana:
  - Need for GRPC ingesters with millisecond precision
  - Full payload preshoting systems
  - Standard reaction-time agents would be too slow
  - Jupiter or SDK implementations introduce ~4 second delays (too slow)
  - Token creation monitoring requires live Twitter feeds and automated bundlers

### Project Inquiries
- Interest in building on the Hyperscape platform
- Mention that the developer of Mirquo is assisting P89
- Request for London-based developers for a UK project

### Miscellaneous
- Several messages about token price movements and trading
- Question about whether the DegenAI main account on X (Twitter) might be unbanned
- Turbo build tool experiencing high memory usage issues (21GB+)

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: How does Eliza work?**  
**A:** "It lets you create an agent and equip any kind of specific data, any AI models at the same time, plugins (like accessing third party platforms like X, Discord, Telegram or real-world tool connections like an electric device with CPU board, etc.) on your agent. Also you can develop any new plugin you want for any purpose you can imagine on its open source operating system." (Answered by Omid Sa)

**Q: Is there a Hyperscape channel or separate Discord?**  
**A:** There's a developer Discord, but it's currently only for developers. You'd need to DM for access. (Answered by The Light)

**Q: Is DegenAI still being updated?**  
**A:** Yes, Odlitime is working on its development. (Answered by Omid Sa)

**Q: How can useModel be used with custom code?**  
**A:** useModel can be used with the provider option when using custom code. (Mentioned by Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Eliza Functionality Explanation**:
   - Helper: Omid Sa
   - Helpee: KAFKA (new user)
   - Context: New user asking how Eliza works
   - Resolution: Provided comprehensive explanation of Eliza's agent creation capabilities, model integration, and plugin system

2. **Hyperscape Development Access**:
   - Helper: The Light
   - Helpee: Davenci
   - Context: Davenci wanted to know where to find Hyperscape community and how to contribute as a developer
   - Resolution: The Light informed about a developer Discord and suggested DMing for access

## Action Items

### Technical
- **Investigate memory consumption issues with Turbo builds** (Mentioned by Odilitime)
  - Address the high memory usage (21GB+) during builds
- **Implement GRPC ingester for processing DEX transactions** (Mentioned by Chucknorris)
  - Required for profitable trading on Solana with millisecond precision
- **Develop full payload preshot system for Solana trading** (Mentioned by Chucknorris)
  - Necessary component for effective automated trading
- **Create live Twitter feed integration for token creation monitoring** (Mentioned by Chucknorris)
  - Required for automated token creation detection
- **Continue development of DegenAI** (Mentioned by Omid Sa)
  - Ongoing development work by Odlitime

### Documentation
- **Prepare documentation for Eliza knowledge data pipelines** (Mentioned by Jin)
  - Create materials for upcoming presentation/show-and-tell

### Feature
- **Share polymarket phase 2 update on ElizaOS plugin** (Mentioned by DoramOS)
  - Update to polymarket functionality
- **Building on Hyperscape platform** (Mentioned by Davenci)
  - Interest in developing on the Hyperscape platform

ai_news_elizaos_discord_md_2026-01-03.content:
# elizaOS Discord - 2026-01-03

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Agent Development & Architecture
- **RoseOS Framework**: A new framework built on top of ElizaOS was shared, focusing on designing autonomous systems with explicit agency boundaries, constraint-aware reasoning, and accountability layers.
- **Multi-Model Agents**: Technical discussions about implementing agents that use different LLM models (Anthropic and OpenAI) for specific tasks within a single agent.
- **Deployment Options**: Stan recommended container deployment through ElizaOS CLI for agents with custom plugins, particularly for those requiring specialized functionality.
- **Agent Configuration**: Questions arose about adding knowledge sections to JSON configurations, suggesting users are looking to enhance agent memory capabilities.

### Technical Improvements
- **Enhanced Logging System**: Stan implemented significant improvements to the logging system through PR #6263, including a new linter in the eliza/config package that warns developers when logs are in the wrong format.
- **Plugin Versioning**: Issues were reported with Discord plugin versioning, specifically regarding the failed publishing of v1.3.4 and the jump from v1.3.3 to v1.3.5.

### Project Direction & Philosophy
- **Autonomy Engineering**: The RoseOS framework emphasizes treating autonomy as an engineering problem rather than a hype feature, focusing on control surfaces, decision limits, and predictable behavior.
- **Value Proposition Debate**: Some skepticism was expressed about ElizaOS's capabilities beyond being a wrapper for AI models, prompting discussion about its unique value proposition.

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Can I implement two models in one agent, like Anthropic & OpenAI at the same time, and determine for which task use which model?**  
A: Use Openrouter plugin and define provider/LLM model in your env file. (Stan ⚡)

**Q: Should I deploy my agent with custom plugins outside of cloud?**  
A: You can deploy your agent inside cloud containers using ElizaOS CLI. (Stan ⚡)

**Q: How does eliza work and why should I use it?**  
A: It's a framework for building AI agents with various capabilities. (Kenk)

**Q: Eliza is an operating system?**  
A: Yes it's an open source AI framework for AI agents. (satsbased)

**Q: Did Stan implement the improved logging?**  
A: Yes, through PR #6263. (Stan ⚡)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Multi-Model Agent Implementation**
   - Helper: Stan ⚡
   - Helpee: Omid Sa
   - Context: Implementing multiple models in one agent
   - Resolution: Suggested using Openrouter plugin and defining provider/LLM model in env file

2. **Agent Deployment Guidance**
   - Helper: Stan ⚡
   - Helpee: Omid Sa
   - Context: Deploying agent with custom plugins
   - Resolution: Recommended using cloud containers with ElizaOS CLI

3. **ElizaOS Documentation**
   - Helper: Borko
   - Helpee: i3
   - Context: Understanding ElizaOS
   - Resolution: Shared documentation link

4. **Browser Plugin Troubleshooting**
   - Helper: Omid Sa
   - Helpee: Unknown
   - Context: Browser plugin issue
   - Resolution: Advised to ensure using the latest version and check for updates in Chrome store if using Microsoft Edge

5. **AI Content Guidelines**
   - Helper: Omid Sa
   - Helpee: roseOS
   - Context: Posting AI-generated content
   - Resolution: Reminded to review AI-generated content before publishing

## Action Items

### Technical
- Investigate Discord plugin versioning issues (v1.3.3 to v1.3.5) | Fix failed publishing of v1.3.4 (Mentioned by YogaFlame)
- Implement solution for using different models for specific tasks | Configure agent to use Anthropic for calculations and OpenAI for reasoning (Mentioned by Omid Sa)
- Resolve agent memory/recall issues | Add knowledge & lore sections to JSON configuration (Mentioned by YogaFlame)
- Fix API integration issue | Resolve "Model not found" error when using agent ID and API endpoints (Mentioned by BAOVERSE🌟)
- Integrate the new logging linter from eliza/config package into projects and plugins (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)

### Documentation
- Create clearer examples of ElizaOS capabilities | Provide concrete examples beyond "AI agents" to demonstrate value (Mentioned by i3)

### Feature Requests
- Add Twitter poll creation capability | Enable agents to create and post Twitter polls (Mentioned by Christian)
- Consider Eliza-owned agentic AI implementation as a lead funnel for cloud services (Mentioned by Kenk)

github_summaries_week_latest_2025-12-28..content:
# Overall Project Weekly Summary (Dec 28 - 3, 2025)

This week, development focused on strengthening the core platform's stability and user experience, with critical fixes to data logging and the agent chat interface. Simultaneously, we laid the groundwork for future growth by initiating major security and performance upgrades for plugins and opening discussions on next-generation agent architecture, all while seeing strong community collaboration on key user issues.

### Key Strategic Initiatives & Outcomes

**Strengthening the Core Platform for Stability and Performance**
A reliable and modern platform is the foundation for all agent activity. This week, we made significant strides in improving the backend and developer toolchain.
-   Ensured all agent interactions with streaming language models are reliably logged to the database, improving our ability to monitor and debug agent behavior in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).
-   Modernized the command-line tools by replacing older libraries with faster, native alternatives, improving performance and developer experience in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).
-   Standardized internal server communication routes to improve system reliability and prevent errors in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).

**Improving the Agent Chat Experience**
A smooth and intuitive chat interface is crucial for effective human-agent interaction. We closed out several bugs to make the chat experience more reliable.
-   Resolved bugs that caused conversations to duplicate when switching between agents and ensured that clicking an agent always opens the most recent chat in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).
-   Implemented the ability for users to rename their chat sessions, a key usability feature, in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).

**Enhancing Plugin Security and Capabilities**
Expanding what agents can do securely and efficiently is key to their utility. Work began on significant upgrades to our Twitter and OpenAI plugins.
-   Began implementing a more secure authentication method (OAuth2 PKCE) for the Twitter plugin, preparing for more robust and secure agent interactions in [elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter).
-   Started work to improve media processing in the OpenAI plugin with better image description handling and performance-boosting caching for audio and images in [elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai).

**Fostering Community Growth and Support**
Our ecosystem thrives on community contributions and collaboration. This week highlighted active engagement in both expanding the platform and supporting users.
-   A new community-developed plugin, `plugin-coinrailz`, was submitted to expand our ecosystem and is now under review in [elizaos-plugins/registry](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry).
-   Improved the developer onboarding experience with significant documentation updates, including new READMEs and clearer build instructions in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).
-   Community members demonstrated strong peer-to-peer support by providing detailed workarounds for a complex user migration issue across [elizaos/docs](https://github.com/elizaos/docs) and [elizaos-plugins/registry](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry).

**Planning for Next-Generation Agent Architecture**
We are actively designing the future of ElizaOS to support more advanced AI capabilities, opening several forward-looking discussions this week.
-   Opened discussions in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) to add core support for Chain-of-Thought (CoT) reasoning, a technique that allows agents to perform more complex, multi-step tasks.
-   Proposed a major redesign of the internal messaging system to improve reliability and prevent errors like double-processing of messages in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza).

### Cross-Repository Coordination

**Addressing User Migration Challenges**
A user reported difficulty migrating to ElizaOS due to an unsupported wallet. This issue ([#6211](https://github.com/elizaos/docs/issues/6211)) sparked discussion across the `docs`, `registry`, and `eliza` repositories, where community members collaborated to provide detailed troubleshooting steps and potential workarounds. This highlights our community's commitment to helping users navigate complex technical hurdles and the interconnected nature of our documentation, plugin ecosystem, and core platform.

## Repository Spotlights

### elizaos/eliza
The core repository saw significant activity focused on stability, user experience, and future planning.
-   A critical fix was merged to ensure streaming LLM calls are properly logged to the database ([#6296](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6296)).
-   The CLI toolchain was modernized to use Bun-native processes, improving performance and aligning with project standards ([#6289](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6289)).
-   Server message routes were standardized to improve system reliability ([#6285](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6285)).
-   Numerous UI issues were resolved to improve the agent chat experience, including fixes for duplicated conversations ([#6282](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6282)), ensuring the most recent chat opens correctly ([#6281](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6281), [#6295](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6295)), and adding chat renaming functionality ([#6278](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6278)).
-   Developer documentation was enhanced with a new README for a dummy services package ([#6290](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6290)) and updated installation instructions ([#6288](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6288)).
-   Strategic discussions were initiated for future architectural improvements, including Chain-of-Thought support ([#6294](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6294)) and a refactor of the messaging API ([#6298](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6298)).

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai
Work began on improving the performance and reliability of media handling within the plugin.
-   A new pull request ([#23](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-openai/pull/23)) was opened to fix image descriptions and introduce a caching layer for both audio and image handlers.

### elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter
A significant security enhancement was initiated for the plugin's authentication system.
-   Work started on implementing the more secure OAuth2 PKCE authentication flow, which will also simplify configuration ([#46](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter/pull/46)).

### elizaos-plugins/registry
Activity was driven by community contributions to expand the plugin ecosystem and provide user support.
-   A new pull request ([#245](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/pull/245)) was opened to add the community-created `plugin-coinrailz` to the registry.
-   Community members provided valuable support on an active migration issue ([#6211](https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/registry/issues/6211)), offering detailed workarounds for users with unsupported wallets.

### elizaos/docs
The documentation repository saw new work initiated and continued community support efforts.
-   A pull request ([#81](https://github.com/elizaos/docs/pull/81)) was opened to begin updating project documentation.
-   Community collaboration was prominent in the discussion on issue [#6211](https://github.com/elizaos/docs/issues/6211), where a user received peer-to-peer support for a complex wallet migration problem.

github_summaries_month_latest_2026-01-01.content:
# Overall Project Monthly Summary (January 2026)

## Executive Summary (2-3 sentences)
January marked a pivotal month of strategic planning, as we defined a clear and ambitious roadmap for the next phase of ElizaOS. This effort focused on building a robust public agent ecosystem and enhancing the user experience, all while delivering key backend performance improvements to ensure the platform remains fast and reliable.

### Key Strategic Initiatives & Outcomes

-   **Defining the Next Generation of Public Agents**
    The strategic focus this month was on laying the groundwork for a vibrant, open ecosystem where users can discover, share, and build upon AI agents. This initiative is central to our mission of fostering decentralized and collaborative intelligence.
    -   A comprehensive roadmap was established in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) to create a public agent discovery platform ([#6302](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6302)), allow users to fork and customize existing agents ([#6305](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6305)), and enable knowledge sharing between them ([#6303](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6303)).

-   **Improving Platform Performance and Reliability**
    To support future growth and ensure a smooth user experience, we prioritized work on optimizing our core infrastructure. A faster, more stable platform is essential for agent performance and user retention.
    -   The core message service in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) was significantly refactored, resulting in faster execution for multi-step agent actions ([#6263](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6263)).
    -   Work began to resolve a bug in the SQL plugin to prevent incorrect behavior and improve reliability ([#6316](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6316)).

-   **Refining the User Experience and Growth Strategy**
    Alongside backend planning, we outlined key improvements to the user interface and explored new strategies for sustainable growth. These efforts aim to make the platform more intuitive for new users and support our long-term development.
    -   New plans were created in [elizaos/eliza](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza) to refine the user interface, including adjustments to the chat experience ([#6310](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6310), [#6311](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6311)) and fixing interaction bugs ([#6322](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6322)).
    -   Strategies for platform growth were proposed, such as adjusting message limits for guest users ([#6312](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6312)) and modifying initial credit offerings ([#6315](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6315)).

## Repository Spotlights

### elizaos/eliza
The `eliza` repository was the center of a major strategic planning effort this month, defining a clear direction for the project's public-facing features. While much of the work involved creating a detailed roadmap, a key performance optimization was also completed.

-   **Strategic Roadmap:** A large volume of new issues was created to map out the future of the public agent ecosystem, including agent discovery ([#6302](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6302)), standardized URLs ([#6304](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6304)), and agent forking ([#6305](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6305)).
-   **Performance Improvement:** A significant refactor of the core message service was completed to optimize provider handling, enhancing execution speed for complex agent tasks ([#6263](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6263)).
-   **User Experience:** Numerous issues were opened to refine the user experience, addressing UI elements like chat box sizing ([#6310](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6310)) and fixing bugs related to conversation management ([#6322](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6322)).
-   **Plugin Fixes:** Work commenced to address a bug in the `plugin-sql` by using `sql.raw()` to prevent unintended parameterization issues ([#6316](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6316)).
-   **Maintenance:** The copyright year in the project's license was updated for 2026 as part of routine annual maintenance ([#6301](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6301)).

They have fundamentally different user intents and should have a distinct UI.\n\n## State 1: Unauthenticated Visitor (Not Signed In)\n\n**User Intent:** \"I clicked a link on Twitter, I'm curious, let me try this agent\"\n\n**What they should see:**\n\n* Clean chat interface focused on the agent\n* Agent avatar, name, @username, and brief bio/description\n* **No** Private/Public toggle\n* **No** Edit button\n* **No** Fork button (yet—they need to sign up first)\n* Copy shareable link button to share with others\n\n**Interaction model:**\n\n* Allow **2-3 free messages** before soft gate\n* After limit: \"Sign up to continue chatting\" overlay\n\n## State 2: Authenticated Non-Owner (Signed In, Not Creator of Agent)\n\n**User Intent:** \"I want to chat with this agent OR I want to make my own version\"\n\n**What they should see:**\n\n* Chat interface\n* Agent info + creator attribution\n* **\"Chat\"** and **\"Fork\"** buttons (NOT Edit)\n* **No** Private/Public toggle\n* Clear indication this isn't their agent\n* Copy shareable link button to share with others\n\n## State 3: Owner (Signed In, Is Creator)\n\n**User Intent:** \"I want to manage/edit my agent\"\n\n**What they should see:**\n\n* Full control UI\n* **Chat** and **Edit** tabs\n* **Private/Public toggle** with clear state indicator\n* Share button (when public)\n* Analytics/stats (future: views, chats, forks)

The previous\r\nimplementation used Drizzle's sql tagged template which auto-parameterizes\r\nvalues, causing \"syntax error at or near $1\" when ENABLE_DATA_ISOLATION=true.\r\n\r\n- Change sql`SET LOCAL app.entity_id = ${entityId}` to sql.raw() with inline value\r\n- Add unit tests for withEntityContext in manager.test.ts\r\n- Add integration test to verify fix against real PostgreSQL\r\n\r\nFixes critical bug that broke all database operations with data isolation enabled.", "repository": "elizaos/eliza", "createdAt": "2026-01-03T15:40:43Z", "mergedAt": null, "additions": 278, "deletions": 1 }, { "id": "PR_kwDOMT5cIs65nrpU", "title": "refactor(default-message-service): optimize provider handling in MultiStep", "author": "standujar", "number": 6263, "body": "# Risks\r\n\r\nLow. The change only affects the internal execution order of providers in multi-step mode. All providers still execute and return results - just faster.\r\n\r\n# Background\r\n\r\n## What does this PR do?\r\n\r\nConverts sequential provider execution to parallel execution using `Promise.allSettled` in `runMultiStepCore`. This improves performance when multiple providers need to fetch data simultaneously.\r\n\r\n**Before:** Providers executed one after another (sequential)\r\n**After:** Providers execute in parallel with fault tolerance\r\n\r\n## What kind of change is this?\r\n\r\nImprovements (misc. changes to existing features)\r\n\r\n# Documentation changes needed?\r\n\r\nMy changes do not require a change to the project documentation.\r\n\r\n# Testing\r\n\r\n## Where should a reviewer start?\r\n\r\n`packages/core/src/services/default-message-service.ts` - lines 1053-1107\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n", "repository": "elizaos/eliza", "createdAt": "2025-12-18T15:22:21Z", "mergedAt": "2026-01-03T09:55:03Z", "additions": 159, "deletions": 35 }, { "id": "PR_kwDOMT5cIs67Q8hR", "title": "chore(license): update year to 2026", "author": "rejected-l", "number": 6301, "body": "Annual copyright year update.\n\n- Updated year: 2025 -> 2026\n- Files affected: LICENSE\n\n\n\n
